meanings.definition: bushgoats: plural noun, goats that live in the bush
meanings.sent1: The bushgoats grazed peacefully among the trees.
meanings.sent2: We saw a group of bushgoats while hiking in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to imitate the bushgoats by hiding in the bushes.
meanings.sent4: The bushgoats navigated the dense undergrowth with ease.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bushgoats' bells echoed through the woods.

meanings.definition: bushgoats: verb, to herd or tend to goats in the bush
meanings.sent1: We need to bushgoats before the sun sets.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys bushgoating on weekends to relax.
meanings.sent3: The farmer decided to bushgoats under the starry sky.
meanings.sent4: He bushgoated the goats expertly through the rugged terrain.
meanings.sent5: They will bushgoats the herd to greener pastures tomorrow.

meanings.definition: bushgoats: adjective, describing goats that are found in the bush
meanings.sent1: The bushgoats path was filled with fallen leaves.
meanings.sent2: The children were excited to see the bushgoats enclosure at the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox tried to approach the bushgoats pen unnoticed.
meanings.sent4: The bushgoats tracks were visible in the soft soil.
meanings.sent5: The bushgoats habitat provided ample food and shelter for the animals.
